com.contentstack.cms.user

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.contentstack.cms.user.User

  • public class User
extends java.lang.Object
    All accounts registered with Contentstack are known as Users. A stack can have many users with varying permissions and roles.

      Constructor and Description
      User() 
      User(retrofit2.Retrofit client)

      The Get user call returns comprehensive information of an existing user account.

      The Log out of your account call is used to sign out the user of Contentstack account

    • Method Detail

      • getUser

        public retrofit2.Call<okhttp3.ResponseBody> getUser()
        The Get user call returns comprehensive information of an existing user account. The information returned includes details of the stacks owned by and shared with the specified user account.
        Returns:
        UserService

      • getUserOrganizations

        public retrofit2.Call<okhttp3.ResponseBody> getUserOrganizations()
        The Get user call returns comprehensive information of an existing user account. The information returned includes details of the stacks and organisation owned by and shared with the specified user account.
        Returns:
        UserService

      • updateUser

        public retrofit2.Call<okhttp3.ResponseBody> updateUser()
        The Update User API Request updates the details of an existing user account. Only the information entered here will be updated, the existing data will remain unaffected.
        When executing the API call, under the 'Body' section, enter the information of the user that you wish to update. This information should be in JSON format.
        Returns:
        UserService

      • activateUser

        public retrofit2.Call<okhttp3.ResponseBody> activateUser(java.lang.String activationToken)
        The Activate a user account call activates the account of a user after signing up. For account activation, you will require the token received in the activation email.
        Parameters:
        activationToken - Enter the activation token received on the registered email address. You can find the activation token in the activation URL sent to the email address used while signing up.
        Example:bltf36705c7361d4734
        Returns:
        UserService

      • requestPassword

        public retrofit2.Call<okhttp3.ResponseBody> requestPassword()
        The Request for a password call sends a request for a temporary password to log in to an account in case a user has forgotten the login password.
        Using this temporary password, you can log in to your account and set a new password for your Contentstack account.
        In the 'Body' section, provide the user's email address in JSON format
        Returns:
        UserService

      • resetPassword

        public retrofit2.Call<okhttp3.ResponseBody> resetPassword()
        The Reset password call sends a request for resetting the password of your Contentstack account.
        When executing the call, in the 'Body' section, you need to provide the token that you receive via email, your new password, and password confirmation in JSON format.
        Returns:
        UserService

      • logoutWithAuthtoken

        public retrofit2.Call<okhttp3.ResponseBody> logoutWithAuthtoken(java.lang.String authtoken)
        The Log out of your account call is used to sign out the user of Contentstack account
        Parameters:
        authtoken: - authtoken
        Returns:
        UserService

      • logout

        public retrofit2.Call<okhttp3.ResponseBody> logout()
        The Log out of your account call is used to sign out the user of Contentstack account
        Returns:
        UserService
